summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2013/12/26
Average Rating: 4.4
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English', 'English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Colm McCarthy', 'Anthony Byrne'], 'Producers': ['Andrew Lowe (Element Films)', 'Rob Pursey'], 'Starring': ['Own McDonnell', 'Ian McElhinney']}
Review Text: Well written gritty police series set in beautiful scenic western Ireland.  Story lines deal with corruption, deal-making, insidious city crime in a small town, arson, drug smuggling and family conflicts.  Watched two series ... wish there were more.  Good acting, great locales, slight romance, plenty of conflict and lots more room for more episodes.
Review Title: Small town policing - blurred ethical lines!
Rating: 4.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2014/01/30
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['James Strong', 'Euros Lyn'], 'Producers': ['Jane Featherstone', 'Chris Chibnall', 'Richard Stokes'], 'Starring': ['David Tennant', 'Olivia Colman', 'Jodie Whittaker'], 'Studio': ['PBS']}
Review Text: Really enjoyed watching the first season of Broadchurch ... which I did in one sitting.  Couldn't wait to watch the next episode.  The cast was really good, plenty of drama and even the small town vigilantism was plausible.  I think this series was well written and acted and can't wait to see if there will be a Season 2 and how they would move on from the ending.  This series reminded me of the American series, The Killing.  Very believable storyline.
Review Title: Great drama series - unpredictable ending
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2015/03/26
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Español'], 'Directors': ['Lasse Hallstrom'], 'Producers': ['Steven Spielberg', 'Oprah Winfrey', 'Juliet Blake'], 'Starring': ['Helen Mirren', 'Om Puri', 'Manish Dayal'], 'Studio': ['DreamWorks Pictures']}
Review Text: Really enjoyable movie!  All the actors were excellent.  Scenery is very beautiful but almost the entire movie takes place in one village.  I thoroughly enjoyed The Hundred Foot Journey as I have all of Lasse Halstrom's movies!
Review Title: All the actors were excellent. Scenery is very beautiful but almost the entire ...
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2015/04/19
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['James Strong', 'Jessica Hobbs', 'Jonathan Teplitzky', 'Mike Barker'], 'Producers': ['Jane Featherstone', 'Chris Chibnall', 'Richard Stokes'], 'Starring': ['David Tennant', 'Olivia Colman', 'Jodie Whittaker'], 'Studio': ['PBS']}
Review Text: Really enjoyed Season 1 and didn't know how they would do Season 2 (seeming to have wrapped everything up), but Season 2 was great!  The writers did wonderful job reintroducing the earlier unsolved missing and possibly murdered girls mystery; and the Season 1 murder trial and all the ramifications of prosecution and defense strategies and trial testimony were very engrossing!  This is very well written, well cast and well acted!  Can't wait for Season 3, and I hope they can keep the momentum up for a few more years!
Review Title: Really enjoyed Season 1 and didn't know how they would do ...
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

Average Rating: 4.0
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Israel Horovitz'], 'Producers': ['Rachael Horovitz', 'Gary Foster', 'Nitsa Benchetrit', 'David C. Barrot'], 'Starring': ['Kevin Kline', 'Kristin Scott Thomas', 'Maggie Smith']}
Review Text: Interesting story of the inheritance of an interest in a glorious Paris apartment with a sitting tenant with a lifetime lease and a totally hard luck guy just trying to get his hands on what he feels is overdue to him!  It's a bit dark, and even occasionally quite depressing, but does lift out of that to a satisfying conclusion.  Kevin Kline is wonderfully irreverent and can even be quite horrible when he wants to be! Very good cast!  Tip of the hat to Maggie Smith and Kristin Scott Thomas.
Review Title: Dark Comedy, Exceptionally Good Cast
Rating: 3.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===

Average Rating: 4.9

Review Text: Great story, wonderful period costumes and social drama, excellent cast and and beautiful scenery.  How could you go wrong?
Review Title: Classic Austin, Beautifully Depicted
Rating: 4.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2015/06/08
Average Rating: 4.2
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Susanna White'], 'Producers': ['David Parfitt', 'Selwyn Roberts', 'Michele Buck', 'Damien Timmer', 'Ben Donald'], 'Starring': ['Benedict Cumberbatch', 'Rebecca Hall', 'Roger Allam'], 'Studio': ['HBO']}
Review Text: Excellent WWI story about honor and love and societal expectations and destructive relationships and the toll they take on lives.  This was extremely well written, had a superb cast and was wonderfully produced.  Very well done all around.  I developed a whole new respect for Benedict Cumberbatch.  He's quite the actor!
Review Title: Wonderfully Done Period Drama
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2015/08/12
Average Rating: 4.6
Product Details: {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Shona Auerbach'], 'Producers': ['Caroline Wood'], 'Starring': ['Emily Mortimer', 'Gerard Butler', 'Jack McElhone'], 'Studio': ['Miramax']}
Review Text: A lovely movie about a mom who goes to great lengths to maintain a lie to protect and care for her son.  Very well done!  Wonderful cast!  Storyline deals with a real life issue for many families.
Review Title: Heart warming family drama
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2015/09/16
Average Rating: 3.8
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Otto Bathurst', 'Simon Curtis'], 'Producers': ['Paul Rutman', 'Simon Curtis', 'Hilary Salmon'], 'Starring': ['David Oyelowo', 'Edward Woodward', 'Hugh Bonneville'], 'Studio': ['HBO']}
Review Text: Well done, interesting mystery that focuses on the ongoing effects and repercussions of tragedy on the family involved.  Liked the extended format.  Several characters were pretty annoying, but it was well acted and a really solid story.
Review Title: Attention grabbing missing person mystery!
Rating: 5.0

Review Title: Five Stars

Average Rating: 4.4

Review Title: Must watch Holmesian drama
Rating: 5.0

=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2019/03/02
Average Rating: 3.7
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Gary Yates'], 'Producers': ['Paula J. Smith'], 'Starring': ['Jennifer Finnigan', 'Natalie Brown', 'Shaun Benson'], 'Studio': ['Kew Media Group']}
Review Text: Truly poor - shallow, poorly developed & unlikeable characters who didn’t seem to even like each other.  A bride who showed zero concern for her missing groom-to-be throughout the entire movie.  Poor script, weak plot and over-the-top acting.  This is drivel & a waste of time to watch.  I've read many 'cosy mysteries' and this movie tries to bring one to the screen, but the entire plot is poorly developed and the characters are unreal.  For example, one character goes from making love to her old boyfriend who soon afterwards pushes her off a cliff allegedly because she had previously broken up their relationship.  Not even soap opera good.
Review Title: Poorly done (decent cast, poor plot, erratic story line and not very nice characters)
Rating: 1.0
--------------------------------------------------

raw_response:
**Preferences and Patterns:**

- **Genre Affinity**: Strong preference for drama, particularly in police procedurals and mysteries.
- **Character Focus**: Enjoys strong character development, especially in smaller towns with ethical complexities and family conflicts.
- **High Ratings**: Frequently awards high ratings (4.5+), indicating strong satisfaction with well-crafted narratives and performances.
- **Ensemble Casts**: Prefers stories with notable ensemble casts, appreciating strong performances, especially from established actors.
- **Dark Themes**: Shows an inclination towards darker themes involving societal issues, emotional depth, and character flaws.
- **Visual Appeal**: Values beautiful cinematography and scenic settings, often mentioned in reviews, enhancing the overall viewing experience.
- **Continued Investment**: Shows enthusiasm for series, eagerly anticipating new seasons and developments, reflecting a commitment to ongoing narratives.
- **Critical Analysis**: Provides thoughtful critiques, highlighting issues with pacing, character depth, and plot development, indicating a discerning viewer.
- **Mixed Reactions**: Occasionally expresses disappointment in poorly executed plots, signaling high expectations for quality storytelling.

target_interaction.title: Not worth the rental fee
target_interaction.text: Poor plot, unappealing characters, American leads ... stopped watching 1/4 way into movie.  Poorly done.
